ผู้ขุด Bitcoin Marathon Digital โอน 1,318 BTC มูลค่า $87M จะเกิดการขายออกหรือไม่

Bitcoin Miner Marathon Digital Transfers 1,318 BTC Worth $87M, Is a Sell-Off Coming

8h ago//Rizwan Ansari
bitcoinmining
AI

Summary

TH

บริษัทขุด Bitcoin อย่าง Marathon Digital ได้โอน 1,318 BTC มูลค่าประมาณ 87 ล้านดอลลาร์ไปยังแพลตฟอร์มสถาบันชั้นนำ เช่น BitGo และ Galaxy Digital ซึ่งกระตุ้นความกังวลเรื่องแรงขายที่อาจเกิดขึ้นใหม่ขณะที่ราคา Bitcoin อยู่ที่ระดับประมาณ 65,000 ดอลลาร์ อย่างไรก็ตาม Marathon ยังคงถือ Bitcoin ไว้มากกว่า 52,850 BTC สะท้อนให้เห็นว่าการโอนนี้มีจุดประสงค์เพื่อการจัดการคลังหรือใช้เป็นหลักประกันมากกว่าการขายออกทั้งหมด ตลาดเผชิญกับแรงขายเพิ่มขึ้นทั้งจากผู้ขุดและผู้ถือรายใหญ่ (whales) เนื่องจากราคา Bitcoin ต่ำกว่าต้นทุนการขุดเฉลี่ยที่ 87,000 ดอลลาร์ ข้อมูลแสดงให้เห็นว่าผู้ขุดต้องขายเพื่อรักษาสภาพคล่อง ในขณะที่ผู้ถือรายใหญ่ได้ขาย Bitcoin ออกไปกว่า 81,000 BTC ในรอบ 8 วัน ลดส่วนแบ่งการครอบครองลงถึงระดับต่ำสุดในรอบ 9 เดือน ซึ่งอาจนำไปสู่ความผันผวนที่สูงขึ้นในระยะสั้น

EN

Bitcoin miner Marathon Digital has transferred 1,318 BTC, worth approximately $87 million, to institutional platforms including BitGo and Galaxy Digital. This move has raised concerns about potential selling pressure as Bitcoin trades near $65,000 following a recent price drop. However, Marathon retains a significant holding of over 52,850 BTC, suggesting the transfer is likely for treasury management or collateral rather than a full exit. The broader market is facing increased downward pressure from both miners and whales. With Bitcoin trading below the average mining cost of $87,000, many miners are forced to sell at a loss to cover operational expenses. Additionally, large holders have offloaded over 81,000 BTC in the last eight days, reducing their control over the supply to a nine-month low and contributing to market volatility.

Key Points

  • Marathon Digital transferred 1,318 BTC (~$87M) to institutional platforms, signaling potential selling or treasury rebalancing.
  • Bitcoin miners are under pressure as prices trade below the $87,000 average mining cost, forcing losses.
  • Bitcoin whales have sold over 81,000 BTC in eight days, dropping their supply control to a nine-month low.
  • Marathon retains over 52,850 BTC, remaining one of the world's largest corporate holders.
  • Increased selling from miners and whales is adding volatility to the fragile market.

Article

Bitcoin miner Marathon Digital Holdings has transferred nearly $87 million worth of Bitcoin to major crypto service firms, sparking concerns about fresh selling pressure. The move comes as Bitcoin trades around $64,800 after a sharp drop, adding to fears that miners may be increasing sell-offs. Marathon Digital Bitcoin Transfer Signals Possible Selling On February 6, Marathon Digital Holdings moved a total of 1,318 BTC valued near $87 million to institutional platforms, including Two Prime, BitGo, and Galaxy Digital. These are well-known institutional platforms that provide custody, trading, and liquidity services. When a mining company sends coins to such firms, it often signals preparation for structured selling, collateral use, or treasury rebalancing. However, the transfers happened within roughly a 10-hour window while Bitcoin traded around the mid-$60,000 range after a sharp daily drop. Marathon Current Bitcoin Holdings Despite the transfer, Marathon still holds about 52,850 BTC worth around 3.42 billion, keeping it among the top corporate Bitcoin holders worldwide. This shows the company is adjusting part of its treasury, not exiting its position. Still, the timing adds to short-term caution. Bitcoin is already down nearly 10% in 24 hours, and broader sentiment is fragile . When miner flows rise during a falling market, traders tend to expect more volatility. Miner & Whale Continue to Sell Bitcoin One major pressure is coming from Bitcoin miners. The average mining cost has risen above $87,000, while Bitcoin trades near $65,402, forcing many miners to sell at a loss. CryptoQuant data shows miner reserves have dropped to 1.806 million BTC, confirming rising sell-offs. Meanwhile, selling is not limited to miners. Santiment data reveals that Bitcoin whales and large holders are also reducing positions. Wallets holding between 10 and 10,000 BTC now control just 68.04% of total supply, a nine-month low. These large holders have sold about 81,068 BTC in the last eight days alone. Never Miss a Beat in the Crypto World! Stay ahead with breaking news, expert analysis, and real-time updates on the latest trends in Bitcoin, altcoins, DeFi, NFTs, and more. FAQs Is Marathon Digital selling its Bitcoin? Marathon transferred $87 million in Bitcoin to institutional service platforms, which often indicates preparing for strategic sales, treasury management, or using holdings as collateral, but it retains over 52,850 BTC. Why are Bitcoin miners selling right now? Many miners are selling because Bitcoin’s price near $65,000 is below the average mining cost of over $87,000, creating financial pressure to cover operational expenses despite potential losses. How much Bitcoin does Marathon Digital still own? After the recent transfer, Marathon Digital holds approximately 52,850 Bitcoin, valued around $3.42 billion, keeping it among the world’s largest corporate Bitcoin treasuries. Are Bitcoin whales selling their holdings too? Yes, large holders (whales) are reducing positions; wallets holding 10-10,000 BTC now control a 9-month low of 68.04% of supply, selling over 81,000 BTC in just eight days. What does miner selling mean for Bitcoin’s price? Increased miner selling during a market dip can add short-term selling pressure and volatility, as it introduces more coins into the market when investor sentiment is already fragile.
